venue.address_2: ~~>Pull way in on grass, almost to water
venue.name: Strawberry"s Park (Kayak Put In)

item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Weather: ????? too soon to list
I will look again Sunday morning at 10 am

Sunday: its not looking great...but i dont see the rain yet..LOL

its local, its not an all dayer, we are close to Barts..

i will say lets go for it..

I got the pop up thing..

maybe someone else has one..so we are "Covered"..



This is one of the most favourite spots for a local paddle. And i hope to make it a joint meeting with the Mass. Kayak group by Laurie.

Strawberry Park is our meeting spot, and we have to move cars to the take out spot for a one way trip.

Everyone unloads here, Everyone drives to Barts, then a few drive us back to Strawberry,
once paddling ends back at Barts, some drive the people that drove us back to Strawberry, its simple and it works, no complaining now !!, then the PotLuck Lunch and Barbie -q can start.

Ok getting to Strawberry Park, the put in and meeting place.

From Hartford:
take I 91 North to exit # 38,
This is the exit for rte 75.
Take a right off of the exit and go North on rte 75 toward Bradley Airport Direction,
go 2.25 miles, cross the river bridge and the first right is RIVER STREET, go apx 1,000 feet and the Park entrance is on the right..go into the drive way around the little circle, we will be unloading in the grass a bit further into the park nearer the river..



Our take out point is behind BARTS Drive In restaurant in the boat ramp area.
This is where we can do a simple Barbie-Q and also get stuff to eat from BARTS if they are open.

ok getting from Strawberry Park to Barts,
Leave Strawberry Park, take a left onto River Street, a left onto rte 75, head toward 91, go under 91 stay on 75 for another 1.25 miles and take a left onto Pleasant Street, (Barts is on the corner of Pleasant and Palisado)
Barts is on the left a short ways after you go under the rail bridge underpass, pull into the boat ramp lot and we will go back to Strawberry.

Remember and PRINT these directions....LOL

Ok bring some food, and other stuff for a short boat trip and get together after..

available Kayaks are:

I have 5 kayaks available but would like a rental doughnation of 15 bucks for each one on this closer local shorter trip.


I have enough safety equipment and paddles for the above boats.

OK if you know which kayak fits your paddling style and know its characteristics say so in your comments..

I can only rent kayaks to full yes RSVP's..(limited carry capacity and none can be left on the trailer)..




BACK UP PLAN ~~>IF THERE IS NO DAM RELEASE WE GO TO RAINBOW RES

Release is planned for 1:00 pm or before, but depends on stored capacity and rain.

un-reserved kayaks by apx 9-11 am. will not be taken to the site.

The Brown Bathtub Pungo 12' with flotation bags installed, Recreational Kayak with Carbon Kalista 230 strait w/ small shaft dia Paddle= = Jackie

The Blue Flipper Dipper Riot Tourlite 15', Short Sea Kayak , no paddle needed= AL-R

The Bananna Yellow Cobra Expidition SOT 18' , Long SOT Sea Kayak with Carbon Kalista 230 bent & small shaft dia Paddle= = ALEX

The Red Eddyline Wind Dancer 18', Long sea Kayak with Carbon Kalista 220 bent w/ small shaft dia Paddle= Durelle

The Red NDK Greenlander Pro 18' , Fast & Long Sea Kayak with Camano 220 Fiberglass or Wood Greenland Paddle= Susanne

See ya all there,
al-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the ORANGE STRIPED TRAFFIC CONES/Kayak Trailer by the put in to river

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: --KAYAK EVENT-- STRAWBERRY PARK to BARTS @ Farmington River, & POTLUCK BARBIE-Q
